timeline.bodyText: As mentioned in the comment, test_pardo_timers and test_pardo_timers_clear could be merged. I had to fork it at that time to not lose the coverage for fn_api_runner.
timeline.author: tweise
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -377,11 +377,6 @@ def process_timer(
       assert_that(actual, equal_to(expected))
 
   def test_pardo_timers_clear(self):
-    if type(self).__name__ != 'FlinkRunnerTest':

replies.bodyText: I think it would be cleaner to add an override in the subclasses than test on __name__ here.
replies.author: robertwb

replies.bodyText: We have problems if overriding subclass. The PortableRunnerTest doesn't support clearing timer, but its subclass FlinkRunnerTest and SparkRunnerTest support it.
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: I'm really surprised FnApiRunnerTest supports this but PortableRunnerTest does not. What error do we get?
replies.author: robertwb

replies.bodyText: They are passing now. It seems like because of my FnApiRunner changes.
replies.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: Doesn't this turn off the test for FlinkRunnerTest and anything else that extends PortableRunner?
timeline.author: tweise
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -241,7 +241,8 @@ def process(self, kv, index=beam.DoFn.StateParam(index_state_spec)):
           equal_to(expected))
 
   # Inherits all other tests from fn_api_runner_test.FnApiRunnerTest
-
+  def test_pardo_timers_clear(self):

replies.bodyText: Ah yes. I thought FlinkRunnerTest is inherited from FnRunnerTest.
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: This may also be used for Spark. Skip should probably only occur in leaf classes that strictly need it. Otherwise, we are almost back to what we had before ;-)
replies.author: tweise
